author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1708074852}
review:
Wildlife Park 2 is an ancient game from 2013.  It's 11 years old at the time of this review, and it's dated, because it's using a much older game template from the same developers, but this time with a fantasy skin instead of normal animals.  The devs were so lazy they didn't even change the African safari themed title music!  

In fact this is just a DLC that's misleadingly been released as a standalone product.  The copy + paste developers didn't even bother adding a campaign, so it's free-style only.  Lazy shovelware pushers!

The game lacks support for some modern gaming display resolutions, hasn't been modernised or updated to run smoothly on modern gaming PCs.  Despite this lack of modernisation, it carries a pretty high price tag for such an ancient game.  This seems to have been put on Steam as a nostalgia gouge, or just a cash grab to try profit from abandonware.

The developers didn't design the game for modern gaming PCs, as such the display resolution caps out at around 1440p, there's no support for the state-of-the-art 4K or higher resolutions.  The game simply won't look right on modern gaming displays due to this failure on the part of the developers.

Trying to alt+tab will cause the game to crash... another hangover from an ancient game template and lazy developers who don't test their products.  This is unacceptable for any game in this day and age. 

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a modest spike in player counts for the game.  But this only happened once, around the same time that trading cards were applied to the game... so this is just card idlers getting their cards and moving on.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Wildlife Park 2 is relatively expensive for an abandonware nostalgia gouge, at $1 USD, and it's not worth it.  The game is just too old, hasn't been modernised.  And as the old saying goes, you can't go home again.  This is also competing with over 9,000 free games available on Steam, many of them far better than this paid product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329023834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1668118369}
review:
Je connais ce jeu depuis des années, et bien qu'il ait vieilli, j'aime toujours autant passer 1 ou 2h par jour ) créer un Parc (sans Visiteurs, ils sont par trop tatillons !), et tenter de le rendre viable avec une belle variété d'espèces. 
Il est simple à prendre en main, et si vous ne mettez pas l'option "Immortalité" lors du choix de l'emplacement de votre Parc, vous pourrez nourris quelques-uns de vos carnivores avec... d'autres animaux !
Un plaisir, simpliste parfois, avec quelques bugs étranges (genre un Dragon qui connaissait son Enclos, qui se trouvait SUR une mangeoire... et qui meurt de faim ! Ha ha ha !), mais cela n'empêche pas l'amusement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257293417', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1532576497}
review:
*Note: This is a copy of the review I posted on Wildlife 2*

Okay I'm gonna say it... this game is better than Zoo Tycoon 2 

*Immediately changes name and goes into hiding to avoid assassination from the ZT2 mafia*

Before I explain why let me say that I spent countless hours growing up playing ZT complete collection and ZT2 complete collection, and for this comparison I'm referring to Wildlife Park 2 + all expansion packs and DLCs

Things I like better about WP2:

1. Animal designs are so much more realistic than in ZT2, and many are unbelievable adorable because of it (the otters!!!)
2. Animal's needs and behaviors are more realistic (i.e. needing it to be hotter or colder, interacting with the natural parts of their environment for food, water, shelter, and entertainment)
3. More animal and plant species to choose from (including oddities that can only be achieved through breeding and certain species that have color options when you purchase them)
4. Zoo IS NOT set up on a grid system which allows more design options.
5. Environmental challenges such as weather changes and temperature challenges
6. You don't have to make a zoo, ZT2 made you have a zoo entrance and guests would show up and complain no matter what you did. WP2 gives you the option to make a zoo, nature preserve, farm, ranch, animal shelter, or just a natural environment for the animals to exist in.


Things I like better about ZT2:

1. Terraforming controls are much more user friendly in ZT, however those in WP2 are more realistic in terms of how one would actually landscape and form lakes and deep water tanks
2. The sorting system, WP2 has no sorting system for anything and that can be overwhelming before you know where everything is and tedious once you do.
3. Staff didn't need their own individual buildings, nor did they have a limited range


Really in the end it all comes down to what you are looking for in a zoo game. In my case, I wanted realistic animals more than anything and a wide variety of them on top of that. However, if you want a more user friendly, child safe (I've seen multiple posts in the discussion boards from parents who aren't pleased with the realistic mating in WP2) zoo game, then perhaps ZT2 is better for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1508033076}
review:
Tags: Tycoon&Simulator&Sim&City
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Interactivity about as poor as messing around in a map editor for some outdated game. Even secrets of the magic crystal had more gameplay and fantasy creature variety than this.

Looks heavily pixelated even at 1080p. Only mode is some weird skirmish/sandbox mode where you can define starting ressources. You get what amounts to a barebones empty map. You can make little enclosures and spawn unicorns in it. Dragons not yet for some reason. There were a few other animals that were really inexpensive but they were also locked away for some mystery reason. The whole thing has a bunch of mismatch assets. I was spawning unicorns in what looked like canadian forests. The decorations included things like dinosaur statues and it just felt really mish-mashy. As if the devs just stripped down a different game, put on the models for the two fantasy creatures and just brute forced the shovelware back on market to try for a low effort cash in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090307174', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1508747787}
review: This game sucks. Nothing tells you how to play it, animals starve to death because you can't feed them. Everything is pictures with no mouseover descriptions of what things do. There aren't even any cheats for those of us who are noobs or who suck at this. Unless you're good at picture/icon games with no tutorials avoid this. You can't even get more money. I was playing the "free play" version and I'll bet that's half the problem, even though you buy this game it's probably pay-to-win.

review:
Ich spielte Wildlife Park schon als Kind und habe mir immer Fantasy Tiere gewünscht >7< Von daher bin ich begeistert darüber Einhörner und Drachen halten zu können. Allerdings sollte man sich überlegen ob man es kauft. Ich würde empfehlen entweder das Ultimate Paket zu kaufen das alles enthält oder es zu kaufen wenn es als runtergesetzes Angebot erhältlich ist.  Es sind wirrklich wenig neue Sachen dabei und ich finde man hätte ruhig mehr Fantasy Tiere und Fabelwesen im allgemeinen hinzufügen können, wie Greife, Feen, chinesische Drachen, Wolpertinger usw usf 
Aber ansonsten liebe ich diese Erweiterung *-* Einhörner! <3

review:
It seemed like a good idea at first.

But then things turned for the worst.

This product was deemed too fantastic by the public, and the government was forced to shut it down. This game was the only thing that kept me alive, and they tried to take it away from me. 

I've been in hiding for the past two years, and they still haven't found me yet.

I'm at risk right now but I need to warn you

This game is the best game imaginable, and if you are safe from the government please play this game.

Just know that you are at a high risk of being exposed to extremely good media.

You have been warned

author: {'steamid': '76561198183618787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1426705242}
review:
Voto positivo per la grafica interessante ....
Ma lo dice già la parola expansion  pack cosa sia ...
Perchè questo non è altro che un ' espansione del gioco Wildlife Park 2 , quindi per intenderci , non c'è un tutiorial , non ci sono luoghi dove scegliere " l'inizio " e a parte draghi e unicorni , non ci sono altri animali da allevare , quindi può essere utile a chi possiede il gioco Wildlife Park 2 primario e vuole ampliare nel suo parco , anche l'allevamento di draghi e unicorni , altrimenti , se non possiedi il gioco , puoi sì giocarci , ma è tutto limitato all allevamento di 2 specie di draghi:  uno rosso che non è adatto ai luoghi freddi  come L'UNICA MAPPA  dove possiamo giocare ma bensì luoghi caldi e molto caldi  e uno blu che ben si adatta alla mappa fornita nel gioco ma che dalle statistiche descritte sull'allevamento non sopporta il caldo; e 2 specie di unicorni uno bianco e uno nero , che ben si adattano entrambi alla mappa fornita , unica nota è che detestano la pioggia, quindi quando piove non saranno molto di buon umore...   
Quindi posso dire che se avete Wildlife Park 2 e volete un ampliamento delle razze , ok ci può stare ,  ma decisamente per quello che dà non lo comprerei a prezzo pieno ma aspetterei decisamente non i saldi ma ...  i supersaldi

author: {'steamid': '76561198058467339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1424003657}
review:
WildLifePark2の派生作品のひとつ。
ユニコーン(白と黒)、ドラゴン(赤と青)が追加。それとオリジナルでは条件があった古代の動物が開放されてるっぽい。
オリジナルのようなミッションはなく、フリープレイのみ。マップもオリジナルに加えてファンタジーのマップが1つ追加されているだけ。

これ単体でもゲームは可能だが日本語はサポートされていない。
オリジナルがあればそちらの方から起動することで多少はやりやすくなると思う。英語のままでもそんなに難しくはないけど。

他の派生作品に比べてなぜか安いので気軽に買えるかと。

author: {'steamid': '76561198148437458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1490147970}
review: Okay, so since I'd seen from previous reviews that the dragons would be expensive, I'd started my park with a lot more funds than I usually would've. I didn't require a tutorial because I'd played all the other expansions, and I've gotten to tenth generation Fire Dragons so far. I guess I find this more interesting than other users because I've always been more focused on breeding than doing Missions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056895344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1405937591}
review: Sorry if this review is late but steam is glitching up for me at the moment. Wildlife Park 2 Fantasy is a small EP that is worth the $1 price (if your a fan of this game). this pack contains two types of animals, dragons and unicorns. This is where the pack becomes a little bit disapointing where there is simply a lack of other fantastical creatures such as; ogres, trolls, imps and other creatures based around mythology. Overall this pack will please fans of this game and delivers a new idea that is never before seen in zoo simulators.
